page.title: 14MARY DENDY HOSPITAL
page.content: The Mary Dendy Hospital was opened in 1898. It was named after a ministers daughter from Manchester who founded the hospital. Mary Dendy found out that many mentally retarded children were not benefitting from school. She took 20 children to start with to care for at home. This soon grew to 200 within in a few years. The hospital is now part of the National Health Service and at the moment has 282 patients. Children are no longer admitted and the patients are mainly in the 50-60 age group and the youngest is 16. Very few are now admitted as the new idea is for mentally handicapped people to live in small units in the community. The hospital spreads over a wide area as different houses have been added over the years. Parts of it are in three of our kilometre squares.
